name: VITAMIN D

indications.text: ergocalciferol capsules , usp indicated treatment hypoparathyroidism , refractory rickets , also known vitamin resistant rickets , familial hypophosphatemia .

contraindications.text: range therapeutic toxic doses narrow . vitamin resistant rickets : 12,000 500,000 usp units daily . hypoparathyroidism : 50,000 200,000 usp units daily concomitantly calcium lactate 4 g , six times per day . must individualized close medical supervision . calcium intake adequate . blood calcium phosphorus determinations must made every 2 weeks frequently necessary . x-rays bones taken every month condition corrected stabilized .

warningsAndPrecautions: capsule contains vitamin ( ergocalciferol ) 1.25 mg equivalent 50,000 usp units . green colored oval shaped transparent soft gelatin capsules imprinted '194 ' white contain clear light yellow oily liquid . ndc : 70518-1878-00 ndc : 70518-1878-01 ndc : 70518-1878-02 ndc : 70518-1878-03 ndc : 70518-1878-04 packaging : 4 1 bottle plastic packaging : 12 1 bottle plastic packaging : 12 1 blister pack packaging : 4 1 blister pack packaging : 30 1 bottle plastic store 20 25°c ( 68 77°f ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] . protect light . repackaged distributed : remedy repack , inc. 625 kolter dr. suite # 4 indiana , pa 1-724-465-8762
adverseReactions: ergocalciferol capsules , usp contraindicated patients hypercalcemia , malabsorption syndrome , abnormal sensitivity toxic effects vitamin , hypervitaminosis .
indications_original: Ergocalciferol Capsules, USP are indicated for use in the treatment of hypoparathyroidism, refractory rickets, also known as vitamin D resistant rickets, and familial hypophosphatemia.
contraindications_original:
THE RANGE BETWEEN THERAPEUTIC AND TOXIC DOSES IS NARROW.
                  
                     
                        Vitamin D Resistant Rickets:
                     12,000 to 500,000 USP Units daily.

 
                  
                     
                        Hypoparathyroidism:
                     50,000 to 200,000 USP Units daily concomitantly with calcium lactate 4 g, six times per day.

 
                  DOSAGE MUST BE INDIVIDUALIZED UNDER CLOSE MEDICAL SUPERVISION.
                  Calcium intake should be adequate. Blood calcium and phosphorus determinations must be made every 2 weeks or more frequently if necessary.
                  X-rays of the bones should be taken every month until condition is corrected and stabilized.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Each capsule contains Vitamin D (Ergocalciferol) 1.25 mg equivalent to 50,000 USP Units. The green colored oval shaped transparent soft gelatin capsules are imprinted with '194' in white and contain clear light yellow oily liquid.
                  
                  NDC: 70518-1878-00
                  NDC: 70518-1878-01
                  NDC: 70518-1878-02
                  NDC: 70518-1878-03
                  NDC: 70518-1878-04
                  PACKAGING: 4 in 1 BOTTLE PLASTIC
                  PACKAGING: 12 in 1 BOTTLE PLASTIC
                  PACKAGING: 12 in 1 BLISTER PACK
                  PACKAGING: 4 in 1 BLISTER PACK
                  PACKAGING: 30 in 1 BOTTLE PLASTIC
                  
                  Store at 20 to 25°C (68 to 77°F) [see USP Controlled Room Temperature].
                  Protect from light.
                  
                  Repackaged and Distributed By:
                  Remedy Repack, Inc.
                  625 Kolter Dr. Suite #4 Indiana, PA 1-724-465-8762
adverseReactions_original: Ergocalciferol Capsules, USP are contraindicated in patients with hypercalcemia, malabsorption syndrome, abnormal sensitivity to the toxic effects of vitamin D, and hypervitaminosis D.
